content_1: Highly pathogenic H5N8 avian influenza has been confirmed in Trazegnies, Belgium on June 1, 2017. The virus has resulted in the death of 57 birds and an additional 29 being culled. The event is considered ongoing and the source of the outbreak is attributed to the introduction of new live animals. Control measured applied include surveillance outside and within the protection zone, traceability, official destruction of animal products, official disposal of carcasses, stamping gout, control of wildlife reservoirs, zoning, vaccination prohibition, and no treatment of affected animals.
